sub_topic: Using the Fourier transform to solve heat transfer problems
message_1:
A metal plate has initial temperature of 200 degrees Celsius. The edges of the plate are maintained at 0 degrees Celsius. After 10 minutes, the temperature distribution in the plate can be modeled as:

$f(x,y) = 500e^{-20\pi^2t}sin(2\pi x)sin(3\pi y)$

where $f(x,y)$ is the temperature at point $(x,y)$ on the plate at time t in minutes. What is the temperature distribution in the plate after 20 minutes?
message_2:
To find the temperature distribution in the plate after 20 minutes, we need to substitute the given time t=20 minutes into the equation:

$f(x,y) = 500e^{-20\pi^2t}sin(2\pi x)sin(3\pi y)$

So, for t=20 minutes:

$f(x,y) = 500e^{-20\pi^2(20)}sin(2\pi x)sin(3\pi y)$

Simplifying the equation:

$f(x,y) = 500e^{-800\pi^2}sin(2\pi x)sin(3\pi y)$

This equation represents the temperature distribution in the plate after 20 minutes.
